result.execSummary:
The defendant Ervey Duran Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release/Huber privileges, to commence on  7/24/15 at 6:00pm.

DOC Balance Inquiry
DOC Balance Inquiry

Case called at 3:35pm [ma]
Defendant Ervey  Duran in court, in custody with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel verify receipt of Revocation Order and Warrant packet; no factual corrections
The Court raises that the agent may have the incorrect analysis of maximum penalty Mr. Duran is facing.
--the Court and Counsel agree on maximum penalty.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel


On Count #1: The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail.

On Count #2:The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 2 months in Jefferson County Jail, to be served consecutive to Count #1


On Count #3:The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 2 months in Jefferson County Jail, to be served consecutive to Counts #1 and #2


The Court orders 272 days credit to be applied to case; intended to be a time served case.

The Court orders outstanding costs to be paid at the rate of $40 per month beginning on 11/30/16 and on the last day of every month thereafter, until paid in full; non payment will result in 30 days jail, consecutive.
recess: 3:53pm
Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Request is denied
from Def. re: request to reinstate Huber
Court's response to letter from JCSD re: huber: cc: atty's
Letter from JCSD advising huber has been revoked
With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.
Huber/work release notification

Case called at 3:39pm [mo]
Defendant Ervey  Duran in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Teuber submits an Amended Information 
--Atty. De La Rosa admits service and waives reading of Amended Information 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1, #2, and #3 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Counts #1, #2, and #3 of the Amended Information, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, on each count, with conditions:

--On Count #1 of the Amended Information, Mr. Duran is to serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release/Huber privileges, to commence on  7/24/15 at 6:00pm.
--This sentence may be transferred to the Wood County Jail, so long as there is no use of electronic monitoring
---Mr. Duran is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--comply with any STOP or sexual deviance counseling as recommended by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--No contact with KRH (2/10/1999)
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay subpoena fees in the amount of $33


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
The Court requires Mr. Wood to report to the Jefferson Co. Probation office no later than noon tomorrow(7/8/15)
recess: 4:07pm

Case called at 8:52 am [Clerk SH] (Final Status Scheduling Conference)
Defendant Ervey  Duran in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel confirm matter is proceeding to trial

Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Teuber indicates that Tuesday would be better date for trial
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty De La Rosa indicates that he has informed Mr. Duran that today is the last date for settlement & that It appears parties are at impass

Court informs parties that It will inform them if this case will proceed as scheduled by noon tomorrow
5 strikes per side, 1 alternate
Jurors make take notes and ask questions

On State's Oral Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications:
Court finds that the Defendant has 2 prior convictions for impeachment purposes

ADA Teuber indicates that they have 2 witness for trial
Atty De La Rosa: No witnesses
Court informs Atty De La Rosa that if Mr. Duran wishes to settle matter, he is to inform the Court by 12:00 pm today
Recess: 8:59 am 

NEXT: Court's JA to contact Counsel if case is proceeding Monday or Tuesday for trial
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on July 13/14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling notice

Defendant Ervey  Duran in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates resolution has not been met and requests a Trial date.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court reminds Mr. Duran that his last opportunity to enter a plea will be on the FSSC.
The Court reminds Mr. Duran that his bond and its conditions remain in effect,

Case called at 9:56 am [Clerk SH] 
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Ervey Duran in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No presence at or around 212 Anderson Dr. Johnson Creek
-No direct or indirect contact with KRH
-No sexual contact with anyone under the age of 18
-Not be at school KRH attends
-Booking at JCSD 
Recess: 10:00 am
